page.title: 03FARMING..PITBLADDO FARM
page.content: Pitbladdo farm is situated North-West of Cupar. The farm house is built on the site of an old castle and many of the original stones have been incorporated into the house. The name Pitbladdo comes from the Gaelic and apparently meant a piece of land where oats are grown. Originally the land was part of a large estate which incorporated most of the valley. Tithes have always been paid to the local church -originally these were paid in the form of bowls of produce, now the owners of the farm pay Â£7 per year. This entitles the family to free wedding and free funeral services and their own pew in the church. The estate was broken up last century and Pitbladdo is now owned by the Stewart family who farmed it as a limited company.
